Title: Object: The Angel Gabriel
Description: Manuscript page, detached from manuscript; painting of angel Gabriel blowing a trumpet, from the the ʿAja'ib al-Makhluqat of al-Qazvini. Enlarged title appears directly under angel, but refers to next section of text, while six additional lines of text appear underneath. Text on verso refers to Israfil blowing his horn on the Day of Judgement. Opaque watercolour and ink on paper.
Curator's comments: The Archangel Gabriel blowing a trumpet, from the Wonders of Creation of al-Qazvini Iraq, Baghdad, 14th century Opaque watercolour and gold on paper According to the Qur'an the archangel Israfil will sound the trumpet on the Day of Judgement and the archangel Gabriel will call all souls and direct them to pass before God. However, in Qazvini's Wonders of Creation Gabriel is depicted as the herald of the heavens, blowing his horn. The form of Gabriel's trumpet is similar to the karna, measuring up to 2.5 meters long. This type of horn was used in battle and processions.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2016-2017 19 Sep-8 Jan, New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Jerusalem in the Middle Ages
